item.title: White House disappointed by China rejecting COVID-19 origin probe plan
item.description: The White House said on Thursday it is "deeply disappointed" in China's decision to reject a World Health Organization (WHO) plan for a second phase of an investigation into the origin of the coronavirus.

item.title: Palace: Priority bills should be passed into law by end 2021
item.description: “Let me just say that if there are priority bills, these should be passed as soon as possible," Harry Roque said in a briefing. "Because if these are still pending by next year, alam natin busy na sa pulitika ang lahat [we all know everybody will be busy with politics],” he added referring to the political season ahead of Eleksyon 2022.

item.title: Kiko, Risa welcomes SC saying Philippines obliged to cooperate with ICC despite withdrawal
item.description: While they respect the Supreme Court s junking of the petition challenging the Duterte administration s unilateral withdrawal from the Rome Statute, opposition lawmakers welcomed the High Tribunal's ruling on the Philippines' obligations to the International Criminal Court.

item.title: Binatilyong nasangkot dati sa gusot sa barangay, idol na ngayon dahil sa ginawang kabutihan
item.description: Pinatunayan ng isang binatilyo sa Ifugao na kaya niyang magbago at walang ibang pinakamasaya sa kaniyang ginawa kung hindi ang kaniyang mga magulang.

item.title: Bohol starts J&J COVID-19 vaccine rollout
item.description: The provincial government of Bohol has started the rollout of Johnson & Johnson s (J&J) single-dose coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) vaccine for individuals as it celebrated the 167th Bohol Day on Thursday, July 22.

item.title: Latest Delta case not a local patient of Bicol region
item.description: "The patient is a 27 year old female from Sorsogon who has neither travelled to Bicol for the last 3 years nor have been visited by someone from Bicol before getting sick. Hence the patient is not a local case of the Region," DOH Bicol CHD said.

item.title: Ilocos Norte healthcare workers seek two-week timeout
item.description: Medical workers in Ilocos Norte are asking for a timeout for two weeks for fear that hospitals and health workers will be overwhelmed from the uptick of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) cases.

item.title: Utterly ruined : The debris-strewn aftermath of China s record rains
item.description: Homes in ruins, pulverized roads and a sea of mud coating cars, the once affluent central Chinese town of Mihe was still in shock Thursday as residents turned to food handouts and slept rough after record-breaking storms.

item.title: Radio commentator na pauwi para ipagdiwang ang kaarawan ng asawa, patay sa pamamaril sa Cebu
item.description: Patay ang isang radio commentator sa Cebu City matapos siyang barilin sa labas ng radio station nitong Huwebes ng umaga. Ang biktima, pauwi na sana para ipagdiwang ang kaarawan ng asawa.

item.title: Sotto to let party decide on official VP nominee
item.description: Senate President Vicente Sotto III said he is leaving it up to his party, Nationalist People s Coalition, to decide on its official nominee for vice president in Eleksyon 2022.

item.title: Marikina River water level still normal amid monsoon rains
item.description: The water level of the Marikina River was still normal amid the incessant rains brought by southwest monsoon that was enhanced by Typhoon Fabian, the Marikina government said Thursday.

item.title: James Jimenez explains absurd reason why Comelec can t stop premature campaigning
item.description: Some activities spearheaded by politicians could perhaps be seen as premature campaigning, which is unlawful--but in the latest episode of The Howie Severino Podcast, Comelec's James Jimenez explained why they can't do anything to stop it.

item.title: Philippines confirms local transmission of COVID-19 Delta variant
item.description: The DOH made the announcement after the phylogenetic analysis conducted by the University of the Philippines - Philippine Genome Center, and case investigation by the DOH Epidemiology Bureau and the regional and local epidemiology and surveillance units, showed clusters of Delta variant cases "linked to other local cases, therefore, exhibiting local transmission."

item.title: With more LGBTQ athletes than ever, Olympics put focus on Japan
item.description: More than 160 openly lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and queer athletes are due to participate in the Tokyo 2020 Olympics, making this year's Games the most inclusive ever. That has put a focus on host nation Japan, which activists say is out of step with much of the rest of the world.

item.title: Cleaners at flooded pumping stations plead: Throw your garbage properly
item.description: Garbage blocking pumping stations has aggravated flooding problems in Metro Manila, and the MMDA personnel tasked to remove it are pleading with Filipinos to dispose of their trash properly.
